author: Mateo K.
text: There's a reason why Lord of the Rings trilogy is so highly regarded. Practical effects, real costumes and makeup instead of green suit, weird camera perspectives to make the hobbits smaller instead doing it in post (highly recommend looking into that it's super interesting), just make a way more appealing imagery than knowing that everything you see is basically a video game cutscene. That's why the Hobbit is so dogshit in comparison because relied HEAVILY on cgi

author: BloodyRed
text: I just enjoy practical effects, it invites the viewer into the movie making process, most of the force awakens aliens were practical costumes, and i loved it. Even if it was cg and it looked the same, id still prefer practical.
replies: Personally as long as the shot looks good I don't give a fuck how they did it. I saw Oppenheimer at cinemas and the huge explosion that was hyped up was pretty mediocre as far as movie explosions go. Nowhere close to what Michael Bay has done with practical effects for explosions.

author: TopazBeast
text: It really is crazy how far CGI has come, even just on YouTube channels like Kane Pixels, his video with the staircase and mall is all completely CGI, looks insane  and it's just one dude with computer software
replies: Its not a solo project but I love how corridor crew challenges how special effects are made, not only with commentary and criticisms but good creative works with new tools available hollywood is barely starting to play with.
@buggoly bug It really was, not even trying to glaze but that might have been the best "found footage" styled horror I've ever seen
Rolling giant was so good
Cold Ones is a good example too, lately they've been using sm cg/blender for such small gags that a lot of ppl don't even notice, Prezoh goat editor

Yeah I'm studying Computer Science and the fundamental reason I love it so much, is because you can litterally create Worlds.
Look at Minecraft and No Man's Sky for example.
Randomly generated endless terrains, physic simulations etc. You can basically play god and the only thing holding you back, is knowledge and creativity.

It's not even computational power, though it makes things easier since you don't have to spend so much time on being super efficient
